snippet: A boy who was buried at a reform school with a history of unsanitary and decrepit conditions was for the first time positively identified among the scores of remains that were found in unmarked graves.
abstract: George Owen Smith, boy who disappeared from Arthur G Dozier School for Boys in Florida in 1940, is positively identified from among scores of remains in unmarked graves there; school was known for unsanitary and decrepit conditions.
lead_paragraph: A boy who was buried at a reform school with a history of unsanitary and decrepit conditions was for the first time positively identified among the scores of remains that were found in unmarked graves.

headline.main: Florida: First Body Identified at Boys’ School
headline.print_headline: Florida: First Body Identified at Boys’ School

keywords.value: Dozier, Arthur G, School for Boys
